chunks.chunk_text: Hello you guys!每週來到英語咖啡館喝一杯老師們的本週主題特調一起探討國際文化、時事、網路和音樂等多元主題輕鬆吸收主題相關的詞彙慣用語和常用例句喔!

chunks.chunk_text: Smile to the camera.Can you believe that?That's kind of interesting.So, how do you spell quokka?Q-U-O-K-K-A?Q-U-O-K-K-A, quokka.And it's a mouse looking animal, a relative of the kangaroo.And very important thing that most people don't know.And this is kind of popular in Taiwan.You know the animal called capybara, right?Capybara, yeah.Also a mouse.It's the largest mouse on earth.But the name is called shayt.

chunks.chunk_text: I thought it's a relative of pigs, no?So Japanese made it cute.One time I had to tell my wife, and she says, oh, you know, there's shaytwing farms that you can go see now in Taiwan.And she's like, I want to go see a capybara.And I said, did you know that capybaras are just the largest rodents on earth?And she's like, they don't look like mouse or rats.And I said, yeah, they're the better looking cousins.

chunks.chunk_text: The one who goes to cover, not with it.They're much tamer, and they're more polite, and they're sort of people-friendly.Right.And then, actually, that's time I went to the farm to see the capybara.They were so relaxing and taking a bath.When I gave it a visit, it's so cute.That's why Japanese people love it.They turn it and personalize it into shaytwingjun, right?They even call it like a person.Oh, that's why.Yeah, because they're so chill.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: So I think Australian don't have this kind of humor.So quokka is only within Western country, I guess.Look, let's put it this way.Even for Australians, people living land down under, let's put it this way.They probably know about quokkas, but they don't see quokkas.It's just one of those things.Yeah.So same thing in South Africa.When we were living in South Africa, we knew about all the different animals available in South Africa that's super famous.But really, do we get to see them?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: Do we want to see them every day?No.No.Yeah.Oh.So only for tourists.Yes.But guess what?It's available in Taiwan.So like capybara is not native to Taiwan.We got capybara farms.And then we got meerkats.I don't know if you've seen meerkat cafes recently.You can go have a coffee, sit with your friends, and then they give you a session with the meerkats.And I'm like, I grew up knowing meerkats as just some
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: animal in South Africa.But in Taiwan, it's an exotic animal.It's an exotic pet.It's cool to have a pet meerkat.But the people enjoy in their company.Yeah.Well, meerkats, capybaras, cousins of weasels, cousins of rodents, just mouse.When you speak the truth, it seems like they are less cute than we expect.Yes.So quokkas, right?Imagine their older cousins, the kangaroos.Kangaroos are kind of cute.

chunks.chunk_text: Kinda.Kinda dangerous as well.Yes.The male kangaroos.Very dangerous.Yes.And then they got, I don't know, next time you go to Australia, you have to go check out the wombats.Wombats are kind of cute, too.A little fuzzy, a little bear-looking thing.But the face, the head also looks like almost bear slash mouse.Bear slash mouse.Wow.Yeah.Wombat.Australia.And they are native to Australia only.

chunks.chunk_text: They kind of look like quokka except that they don't smile to the camera.Oh, yeah.No.No.Right?I think the size is also similar or smaller.They were not born influencers.They were not.They need to be trained.They need to be trained.So a little bit about travel and the animals and exotic animals that we get to see around the world.So we welcome Angel back again in Taipei.This time around, we have to talk about, since you travel so much,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: we have to talk about gifting.And since you travel so much and I also lived abroad, so I think today we can definitely touch on some of the interesting gifts that people want us to buy for them or the gifts they want from abroad or some gifts that you may have received that are kind of out of this.Interesting topic.Yeah.But again, to start off, in Taiwan, when you give people gifts, there are a lot of etiquettes.There are a lot of things you got to remember, right?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: Things you should be giving and things you shouldn't be giving.Unless people ask you to buy for them, then that's a different thing.Then that's not a gift.That's more like a souvenir.That the reason why I say it's a gift because most people, they ask you to buy something for them and they don't pay.You probably have run into a couple of these situations where they want you to buy something and then by the time you give it to them, it's like you don't ask them for.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: You're helping them to buy it.Yeah.But you know, when you come back to Taiwan, you meet your family or your friend and you're like, that's okay.Yeah.I think it's quite often when we encounter these situations, like maybe the gift itself is not so expensive, like 100, 200.And then some people might say that it's only 200, so it's okay.But in the long term round, like 10 years, 20 years, like 200 accumulated could be a lot, right?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: So that's the thing that I'm trying to avoid now.Yeah.Well, some souvenirs, if it's big ticket items for sure, then sometimes the person, right?Your friend says, hey, let me pay you back.And you're like, yeah, but you've done me a couple of favors too, so don't worry about it.So that makes sense.That makes sense.With guys, you end up doing that, like returning the favor kind of thing.I don't know about you and your lady friends.Sometimes.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: They ask me to buy too much.I will even top up the price.Yes.You would have to tally it up.And before you arrive, you have to say, okay, I'm landing tomorrow, so I checked my suitcase and it's one, two, three, four, five total this.And just want to double check it with you.Right.And then also, I think this is also one of the etiquette that people should think, should consider.When you ask people to buy something for you, don't ask them
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: to compare the price for you, isn't it?Oh, that's interesting.Yeah.So if like I visit Japan quite often, they will ask me to buy the cosmetic or skincare and then said, oh, can you help me to detect and also compare this product in different stores?Which one is our cheapest?Please buy in the cheapest store.I say, I don't have all day for you girls.Unfortunately, my guy friends never asked me to do that.They're like, oh, yeah,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: get me the camera or something.I check the prices and it's probably cheaper if you go to big camera.That's what guys usually do.Yeah.They've done their job.They've done the research.So I think for ladies, it's more like, you know, I'm doing you a favor because I'm sending you on this errand, but it's a shopping experience for you too.It is.But you know, I used to be that kind of person who likes to compare prices from, let's say there might be five stores in the street.Yeah.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: I will went to all five stores and compare to get the cheapest price, the best deal.But now I think relaxing and having my own time is much more important.I'd rather just finish everything in one store and enjoy my coffee.We have since matured.Time is money.Time is money.Really?Saving 50 yen after browsing three stores is not cost effective.Really?I think the difference
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: is only like 100 yen or something.It's not that much.And looking at the exchange rate today,100 yen is not a lot of money.It's less than 30.Right.Just get it.But let's put it this way.I kind of understand why people want to compare prices because that's kind of what they do because they assume you're on holiday.You can sort of take the trip.But remember, you are sort of
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: on holiday and you're not on holiday because you're also on standby as a crew member.So whenever you are getting your day off, if you're not really taking a break, you are probably standing by for some flight or waiting to be on call.Let's put it this way.So it's kind of different.It's not holiday, holiday.It's not holiday, holiday.And then even though I upgrade to Japan, I only have like 14 hours stay.And then the 14 hours stay,

chunks.chunk_text: I need to sleep and spare time to shop for you.So next time if my friends ask me to do so, I would say that maybe next time you can come to Japan by yourself and enjoy your shopping experience.Yes.Here's the thing.When you get a gift for somebody or ask for gifts or ask for souvenirs or ask for somebody to help you buy something, there are a lot of little etiquette.Things that people don't really realize that only when you run into it then you realize,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: Oh, I don't like it.This is not nice.And unless you are on the, you know, the requesting end, usually people who request it don't realize it's not nice.And the people on the receiving end or requested end say, and then you kind of feel like, why am I doing this?So gifting is a big, I think it's an art, it's not a science.It's an art.That we need to improve years by years.Oh, well, you know, we've had 5,000 years of gifting

chunks.chunk_text: and how far did we come?Not very far.Yes.So assuming.Okay.So talking about gifts, I want to quickly cover some of the craziest, you know, the do's and don'ts in Taiwan in general.I think most people know, but they just cover them instead in case we mistaken because what I think is a taboo may as a Taiwanese person may not be the same for others.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: So a couple of things that I know.First off, you don't buy old people clocks.But can you buy your dad Apple watch?Apple watch is not a clock.It's got a clock function.But it's not a clock.It's a time.Like it just appears time, right?It's not a clock type, right?Oh, analog clock, you mean.So anything digital is fine.So can I give my dad
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: or mom a digital clock or digital timer that tells time?Can.It's not a timer.It's not a clock.It's a timer.It just say that it's not a clock.It's a timer.Then there was a...When I offered to buy my dad Apple watch, he didn't actually read too much into it.I didn't either until my mom says, why are you buying your dad a watch?He needs to buy his own watch.And I said, what the heck?What?And she says, well, watch isn't clocks.You don't buy for old people.And I'm like, oh, I didn't realize that.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: I didn't realize watches and clocks are the same kind of thing.Oh, are they on the same page?I don't...I don't know.I don't...I won't put them like they're together.So clock and watch different, right?Even in Mandarin is different.手表 and 中, right?It doesn't sound similar.I guess.I don't know.Maybe just stay away.So maybe my mom's approach is just to stay away altogether.Ah, maybe for older people.Yes.I think that it doesn't sound good.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: It feels like a tender funeral.Yes.So the Taiwanese thing here, the rule of thumb is if it sounds bad, like 中,送中, right?And then it sounds bad.It's the homophone.And 散.You don't give umbrella, like cute umbrellas to couples.You don't wish them to get divorced or separate.So 散.And then shoes, right?Something about 鞋 that ticks me off, like don't buy people shoes.And I'm like,

chunks.chunk_text: red envelope, whatever deals when it comes to money or number plates or license plates for that matter.Houses, whatever, preferably no fours.Preferably no fours.Yeah.But I like four.Four is my lucky number, actually.There we go, right?If your lucky number is four, who cares?Who cares, yeah.In Taiwan, our lucky number is triple six, right?But in US, if you have triple six, then I don't know.They're going to send you to church.

chunks.chunk_text: real estate tycoons.Yeah, don't worry.I just know.I just need to know the way to go back to my home.That's it.Okay.So those are some of the things that I know.Because my mom, like, had to educate me with it.But for me, it's like a gift comes from my thought, right?You know, I thought hard and fast about what the other person needs.I think nowadays, if you, if you think, okay, like Jordan eleven, Jordan four, you know, your friend's really a big fan of that.So you still give it

chunks.chunk_text: a pair of Jordan.Still accept it, right?By two pairs, one for me, one for him, done.Good, good.So I think nowadays this kind of taboo might be getting lesser and lesser.I don't know.I mean, some people care, some people don't.Those who care will tell you, like, what are you doing?You don't do this.Ah.Correct?Like me, I got educated.Other than parents, have you ever give some gift that they just mentioned to your other

chunks.chunk_text: friends?Generally, most of my friends, you know, we have very cordial relationships.So if it's gifting time, like Christmas or birthdays and stuff, we are very, you know, open about what we want.So for example, my friend is big into One Piece.I bought him a whole set of One Piece mugs.Oh my.I said, you know, is this something you're looking for?And he says, yeah, this could be nice.And I said, yeah, happy birthday.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: Oh.You know, I don't like to give gifts that people don't, they don't openly say or ask for.You know what I mean?It's hard to guess what the person needs.Hard to guess.It's really, really hard to guess.Unless you have a baby or unless you, you know, you have a particular need, a very specific need.Yeah, that's easy.But generally, when you're 20 something and you kind of buy stuff for yourself, I don't know, what do you want to buy your friends with?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.268_ 怪奇禮物與分不清楚是幫買跟送禮 Is it still a gift if your friend asked you to buy.json

chunks.chunk_text: What do you want to give to them?It's really, really hard.I think buying gifts for guys is much more harder.I mean, for girls, easy, right?Skincare, perfume, cosmetic, that will do.Ninety-nine percent.But for guys, I don't know, video games.Yeah, that should do.I don't know what type you are looking for.Video games, PS5, that would be nice.Right?What?PS5, right?Oh, men needs a PS5.Okay, that goes to a special event.

chunks.chunk_text: So let's put it on the other side.Okay.Yeah, but you know, how much is PS5?I actually don't know.Fifteen thousand.Five hundred US plus minus.I mean, you can sort of pool money.Me, you and another friend can pool money to buy this.Right?It doesn't have to come from just one person.So me and my buddies, we're like very open and upfront.Before my birthday, they would call me and say, hey, you know, what are we doing?
